confession.devil_appearance: appeared as a cat when visiting her in prison
confession.seduction_context: First met when looking for a horse one evening; gave her money which proved to be nothing when she got home. Met again another evening when she renounced God and declared faith in her new master, who promised to make her rich, but money again deceptive
sabbat_locations: a rock for making hail for the plain

witnesses.name: Jean Didier
witnesses.relationship_to_accused: business relationship - sold oxen to her late husband

testimony.quarrel_subject: withdrawn from deal to sell two oxen to her late husband on credit because wife and father-in-law were against it; later reproached for not buying two other bulls
testimony.threat_quote: She told him he would repent

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: week before Christmas, after being refused payment and blamed for accusing daughter of stealing hens

harms_alleged.target: a cow which fell and injured itself

testimony.quarrel_subject: Jean Bedel du Hault chosen as tutor for children of his brother Adam, who had married niece of Jehenne's husband Vallentin. Jehenne and husband were angry because they had wanted to act as tutors
testimony.threat_quote: she told Bedel he would repent and gain little

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: after they threatened him when he asked for payment

testimony.quarrel_subject: Father-in-law was maire for seigneurs of Void; when Jehenne had a child dead this created mortmain which he put up for sale. She and daughter bought it but were angry because they felt it was too dear

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: within 2 days for bull, over next year for 14 cattle total
after animals strayed into her meadow

testimony.quarrel_subject: Her son had been herdsman for pigs of village; did not warn them when it was their turn to feed him; witness told him off but gave him food; Claudette asked what was being said about the porchier

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: after quarrel when refused to sell chickens
same day after working near Jehenne and her daughter

harms_alleged.target: dead girl twins born 5 weeks early

testimony.quarrel_subject: previous husband Colas Jacat had quarrelled with her over a path leading to the water which she used, and he had blocked off

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: a few days later he fell ill, died after 3 weeks

testimony.quarrel_subject: Claudatte came asking to buy two chickens, which she refused to sell, then two were stolen
quarrelled with her son Jean, who wanted to have mortmain of a brother killed in the war at too low a price

harms_alleged.target: a bull and 14 or 15 other animals
harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: after she and Claudette agreed to pay 10 francs for mortmain
before dispute over mortmain, ill for 10 weeks

testimony.quarrel_subject: sick ox which she treated
testimony.threat_quote: Vous ne me faictes poict de bien, tous les autres me vont querir du bois, synon vous

testimony.quarrel_subject: told him his goats were trespassing in her hedge; later sold them grain and asked for payment
testimony.threat_quote: Va, va, en mal santé le puisse manger ton pere

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: same evening after she gave money to son with curse

witnesses.name: Jean Thomas
witnesses.relationship_to_accused: creditor - in dispute for over 50 ecus

testimony.quarrel_subject: in dispute with them for over 50 ecus
dispute 20 years earlier when guarding animals; accused his sister Fleuratte of letting animals damage her crops; enclosed their millet leaving hers outside

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: around same time, did not die

testimony.quarrel_subject: quarrel 12 years before for damage accused and husband alleged had been done in their field; took a pig and held it for 3 days to get resal of wheat as compensation; later quarrelled with Vallentin over some land
testimony.threat_quote: Jehenne told his wife he would repent; later told 'qu'il estoit bien hault et qu'il rabasseroit'

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: a few days after quarrel over land

testimony.quarrel_subject: chased her geese out of his field and injured one
testimony.threat_quote: told him he had killed one of her geese and would repent

harms_alleged.target: a cow, 2 bullocks, an ox, a bullock, another cow, 2 more bullocks
harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: over period of years: cow 3-4 weeks later, 2 bullocks within few days, ox day later, bullock 2 days later, cow 3-4 weeks later, 2 bullocks 6 months earlier
around same time as cow illness

testimony.quarrel_subject: threatened him over a florin she had demanded from him
threw a stick at her sow which was eating his beans; also dispute over garden sale and rental
testimony.threat_quote: told him he would repent before nightfall

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: that evening - fell from tree collecting pears, stayed in bed 6 or 7 weeks
about 4 years earlier after they were angry about garden rental

testimony.quarrel_subject: they had owed him money, and she still owed a little
Jehenne asked to buy a pair of his dead wife's shoes, but he refused
she and her husband wanted to buy his two young bulls but he refused, saying he intended to use them for ploughing

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: next day after husband reiterated request

testimony.quarrel_subject: her daughter Jehennon had been in his service, went back home, but returned after he had dispute with accused

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: 6 weeks after quarrel, after giving birth

testimony.quarrel_subject: had been carting hay for her when he had trouble with cart, and took it back to his house
testimony.threat_quote: threatened to have her arrested and burned if she did not heal him

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: after she passed near Jehenne washing, ill for 3 years

testimony.quarrel_subject: quarrel with late father of witness over apple tree on boundary of their properties

harms_alleged.target: an ox which became as if rabid

timeline.subject: Jeanne Thihard
timeline.details: Arrested

timeline.subject: Jeanne Thihard
timeline.details: Witness depositions begin

timeline.subject: Jeanne Thihard
timeline.details: First interrogation; denied charges

timeline.subject: Jeanne Thihard
timeline.details: Second interrogation; continued denials

timeline.subject: Jeanne Thihard
timeline.details: Confronted with witnesses; began to confess

timeline.subject: Jeanne Thihard
timeline.details: Interrogation after confrontations; confessed to pact with devil, poisoning Jean Didier with apples, making hail

timeline.subject: Jeanne Thihard
timeline.details: Denied apples confession, then became confused; confessed to sabbat attendance

timeline.subject: Jeanne Thihard
timeline.details: Procureur general des Vosges asks for execution by burning

timeline.subject: Jeanne Thihard
timeline.details: Change de Nancy approves execution

timeline.subject: Jeanne Thihard
timeline.details: Denied all previous confessions, laughed saying they made her say many things

timeline.subject: Jeanne Thihard
timeline.details: Renewed denials

timeline.subject: Jeanne Thihard
timeline.details: Visited at her request; said confessions were true but made because she was so intimidated she didn't know what she was saying

timeline.subject: Jeanne Thihard
timeline.details: P.G. asks for question extraordinaire

timeline.subject: Jeanne Thihard
timeline.details: Change de Nancy approves torture

timeline.subject: Jeanne Thihard
timeline.details: Interrogation under torture; racked; after long silence began to confess

timeline.subject: Jeanne Thihard
timeline.details: Made more admissions including killing her own son Didier; sexual relations with devil; devil visited her as cat in prison and beat her for confessing

timeline.subject: Jeanne Thihard
timeline.details: Prévôt visited to secure confirmation; found her 'comme transsye' and could get no response

timeline.subject: Jeanne Thihard
timeline.details: P.G. (Maimbourg) asks for execution with branding in four places on arms, breasts cut off, then burning for killing her own son

timeline.subject: Jeanne Thihard
timeline.details: Change de Nancy approves death by burning alive, without mention of other refinements

timeline.subject: Jeanne Thihard
timeline.details: Formal sentence of death including extras passed and carried out at Bruyeres

accomplices_named.name: Firtousy
accomplices_named.context: devil who was cook at sabbat

notable_quotes.speaker: Jean fils Jean Didier
notable_quotes.french: O les mauvaises pommes, j'ay mal faict
notable_quotes.english: Oh the bad apples, I have been harmed
notable_quotes.context: Cried out after eating apple given by Jehenne, then fell down

notable_quotes.speaker: Colas Jacat (dying)
notable_quotes.french: o le mauvais passage pour moy
notable_quotes.english: oh the bad passage for me
notable_quotes.context: Said she had given him illness as he was dying

notable_quotes.speaker: Jehenne giving money with curse
notable_quotes.french: Va, va, en mal santé le puisse manger ton pere
notable_quotes.english: Go, go, in bad health may your father eat it
notable_quotes.context: Said when giving money to son of Vallentin Gerard Thihar, who then became ill

notable_quotes.speaker: Vallentin to Jehenne
notable_quotes.french: Va meschant gens et genax que vous estez la vache n'a faict qu'entrer et sortir en ma maison Sa faict ta genaxe de femme que luy a donné le mal
notable_quotes.english: Go, wicked people and witches that you are, the cow only entered and left my house. It's your witch of a wife who gave it the harm
notable_quotes.context: About a sick cow claimed to have been harmed in his house

notable_quotes.speaker: Claudon Gerard Thihar's wife to Jehenne
notable_quotes.french: Vous ne me faictes poict de bien, tous les autres me vont querir du bois, synon vous
notable_quotes.english: You do me no good, all the others go fetch me wood, except you
notable_quotes.context: When asked to treat sick ox

notable_quotes.speaker: Adam Ganiel, threat from Vallentin
notable_quotes.french: qu'il estoit bien hault et qu'il rabasseroit
notable_quotes.english: that he was very high and that he would be brought down
notable_quotes.context: Threat during quarrel over land; wife became ill shortly after

notable_quotes.speaker: Devin from Nancy (reported speech)
notable_quotes.french: le Prevost luy avoit dict que comment ledict devin venoit en un villaige et voyant la fumée d'une cheminée il cognoissoit bien s'il y avoit une genaxe ou non
notable_quotes.english: the Prevost told him how when the devin came to a village and saw the smoke from a chimney he knew well if there was a witch there or not
notable_quotes.context: Claude Jacat Morel explaining why he wanted to fetch a devin from Nancy

notable_quotes.speaker: Jehenne in prison
notable_quotes.french: qu'on luy avoit faict dire beaucoups de choses, et qu'elle n'estoit souvenante les avoir dict
notable_quotes.english: that they had made her say many things, and that she did not remember having said them
notable_quotes.context: Denying confessions on February 3, laughing as she did so

notable_quotes.speaker: Jehenne to prévôt
notable_quotes.french: mais que scavoit esté a l'occasion qu'elle estoit sy inthimidée qu'elle ne scavoit ce qu'elle disoit et que sy on luy eut demandé encores d'aultres choses qu'elle l'euct dict
notable_quotes.english: but that it was because she was so intimidated that she did not know what she was saying and that if they had asked her still other things she would have said them
notable_quotes.context: February 7, explaining why she made confessions while begging mercy

Claudatte fille feu Jean Parmentier
Same surname, same location, likely extended family

economic_context.details: Multiple disputes over debts and payments (Jean Didier over oxen sale, Claude Jacat Morel owed money, Jean Thomas in dispute for over 50 ecus, Jacat Andreu Mesnil owed money). Property disputes over mortmain sales (Gerard Thihar as maire, Collatte over mortmain price). Disputes over land rental and sales (Dieudonne Gergoynne over garden). Economic value of animals repeatedly mentioned (loss of cattle, pigs, oxen central to accusations).

historical_context.military_details: Gerard Thihar's son (Jehenne's relative) killed in the war - mortmain dispute arose from this death
economic_hardship_indicators: disputes over small amounts like 2 gros
economic value of animals central to accusations
mortmain sales indicating deaths and property transfers
religious_calendar_references: St James' day (when hail allegedly made)

prior_legal_disputes.description: Multiple debt disputes including over 50 ecus with Jean Thomas, money owed to Claude Jacat Morel, Jacat Andreu Mesnil owed money
Daughter Claudatte accused of stealing 2 hens from widow of Didier Gynatte

legal_context.imprisonment_conditions: Moved to another prison during trial; devil allegedly visited as cat and beat her for confessing

change_de_nancy.modification_details: Change de Nancy approved death by burning alive on Feb 26, but did not approve the extra refinements requested by P.G. Maimbourg (branding in four places on arms and cutting off breasts). However, the formal sentence on March 2 included these extras anyway.

told him it came from la Rebaynne, which was name for her
told him about the apples and illness of Jean Didier
told that daughter Claudatte had stolen 2 hens
had heard that she had threatened him over a florin
told about devin from Nancy who could identify witches by chimney smoke

emotional_state_notes: laughed when denying confessions on February 3
remained 'longtemps pensive, ne voullans dire aultre chose' during confrontations
became confused, contradicting herself, sometimes confessing, sometimes denying
went on knees with hands together begging mercy on February 7
found 'comme transsye' on February 23, could get no response

extraction_metadata.notes: Very detailed trial record with extensive witness testimony (31 witnesses), clear timeline of proceedings including multiple interrogations, confrontations, retractions, torture, and execution. Trial shows pattern of accusations following economic disputes (debts, mortmain, property), threats and quarrels followed by livestock deaths and human illnesses/deaths. Accused initially denied all charges, confessed after confrontations and under torture, retracted confessions, then renewed them under torture. Executed with enhanced punishment for killing her own son. Notable for detailed accounts of healing activities that were later reinterpreted as evidence of causing the original harm. Extensive detail on daily life, economic relationships, and community dynamics. Reputation spans 10-20 years according to various witnesses. La Rebaynne appears to be a nickname for the accused.

formal_accuser.name: Jean Didier
formal_accuser.relationship_to_accused: business relationship - sold oxen to her late husband; son died allegedly from poisoned apples
